column2: Role Description The Tax Operations EMEA team currently consists of four teams being National Tax Reporting responsible for the distribution process as well as fulfilling all German tax requirements for our fund range of German, Luxembourg and Irish funds Tax Reclaim (responsible for filing tax reclaims in various countries on behalf of our fund range of German, Luxembourg and Irish funds) International Tax Reporting responsible for filing tax declarations and/or tax reportings in various countries such as India, Pakistan, Taiwan, Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Italy, Switzerland, UK. Quality & Strategy responsible for analyzing new tax laws as well as tax law changes and developing according strategies to implement changes for all of the other teams as well as analyzing existing processes and process gaps to ensure continuous tax compliance and efficiency. Currently, the team is seeking to setting up an additional team in Pune being the Tax Operations Support team. As a team member you will be supporting the team setup in Pune from the scratch. Going forward you shall continuously support all of the other teams within Tax Operations EMEA, i.e.: You and your team will be supporting the National Tax Operations Team for which you will be responsible to coordinate the (interim) distribution process for our Luxembourg and Irish fund range, compiling appropriate documentation for the application/delivery of various tax documentations as well as creating and monitoring timely submission of tax report packages to internal/external stakeholders. For all these processes/reportings/data work you will be responsible to identify and implement standardization and/or automation of reports pursuing to increase efficiency and/or reduce risk. You and your team will be supporting the Tax Reclaim team for which you will coordinate the surveillance, analysis and solution of so-called tax breaks, i.e. cash differences between the custodians and our own accounting. Also, you will identify and compile data required to file tax reclaims in various countries as well as preparing according applications forms and compiling/monitoring withholding tax rates for different jurisdictions. You and your team will be supporting our International Tax Reporting team. The team is working with local tax advisors to publish/file tax reportings/tax declarations in various countries such as India, Pakistan, Taiwan, Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Italy, Switzerland, UK, etc. . In your role you will be supporting the complete process beginning with the scope determination, the engagement process of local tax advisors, the compiling of data and the monitoring of timely filings/publications. You and your team will support our Quality & Strategy team for which you will be supporting to identify root causes for tax breaks (incl. coordination with custodians and internal stakeholders), setting up and monitoring checklists to decrease tax risks, analyzing existing processes and support automation/standardization efforts. Your key responsibilities  Coordinating and monitoring of various tax processes for all of the other Tax Operations teams including the (interim) distribution process for our Luxembourg and Irish fund range Compiling, processing and analyzing (tax) data for all of the other Tax Operations teams by strongly coordinating with internal stakeholders (other Operations team, Front and/or Middle Office) and external stakeholders (administrators, custodians, tax advisors, tax agents, etc) Monitoring various processes and ensure timely preparations, creation and submission of tax data for all of the other Tax Operations teams Ensure timely preparation and tracking of various reporting requirements (internal/externa) Your skills and experience 5+ years experience in (tax) operational tasks English language skills fluently, German language are an added advantage Self-responsible and reliable way of working including time management skills Strong MS Office Skills, VBA/ PowerBI / SQL skills and similar are an added advantage

column2: Title: US Accounting and Finance Specialist Overview:  The Accounting and Finance Specialist will be responsible for managing various aspects of financial operations, including Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, bookkeeping, accounting tasks, and reconciliation activities. This role requires meticulous attention to detail, strong analytical skills, and a thorough understanding of financial processes. Verify invoice details, including quantities, prices, and terms, and ensure appropriate approvals are obtained. Prepare and perform payment runs, including checks, ACH transfers, and wire transfers. Bookkeeping and Accounting: Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records using accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Xero). Perform month-end and year-end closing procedures, including reconciliations and financial statement preparation. Assist with budgeting, forecasting, and variance analysis as needed. Bank Reconciliation: Reconcile bank and credit card statements to general ledger accounts on a monthly basis. Investigate and resolve discrepancies between bank records and accounting records. Monitor cash flow and identify any unusual transactions or potential issues. Financial Reporting: Prepare and analyze financial reports, such as balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements. Assist in the preparation of regulatory filings and compliance reporting requirements. Provide support for external audits and tax filings as necessary. Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline accounting processes and improve efficiency. column2: We are looking for    Senior Accountant/Assistant Manager- Global Tax & GL.    The role is designed to support to Global Tax Director based in the USA. This is an individual contributor role with key responsibilities supporting the global income tax provision, tax compliance and transfer pricing functions. This person also helps on the GL activities during the close. It also provides excellent exposure to stakeholder management and Group reporting.     All companies want the best and brightest. At Ivalua, we also want team members who have a global point of view and who bring customer-focused enthusiasm and ambition to the table. We are a company of doers, of problem solvers, of figure-it-outers. We have fun and we work hard. Ivalua is a truly global company with a diverse team of contributors and a set of core values that people can feel every day across all our offices.       Responsibilities           Preparation of income tax packages and various supporting book-to-tax computations for the quarterly global tax provision and tax return preparation.     Manage the global income tax compliance calendar including federal and state tax returns, extensions, estimated taxes, tax payments and others.     Prepare income tax journal entries, account reconciliations, and quarterly variance analyses.     Preparation of transfer pricing calculations and transfer pricing journal entries.     Manage APAC withholding taxes including preparation reconciliation, coordination with customers and collection of tax certificates.     Assist with managing tax notices and support tax audits.     SOX related documentation.     Other ad-hoc projects including tax research.     Proactively support in engagement with operations, finance, and tax team to enable business knowledge sharing with the team and help embed into processes as relevant.     Support continuous professional development and good practices with a positive attitude towards building digital skillsets.     Suggest and implement process improvements in all aspects of operational Tax.     Perform certain General Ledger activities during the monthly/Quarterly/Annual close.         Technical Skills / Experience         Previous experience of 5+ years on taxation of working within a Group Tax function in a fast moving and dynamic business, Experience from Big 4 added advantage.     Minimum 3-5 years of US taxation experience and should have managed the US tax return.     Good knowledge of US GAAP, IFRS, IGAAP tax accounting     Experience with MS tools, particularly complicated Excel spreadsheets, ERP system etc.         Personal Attributes and Experience           Good written and oral communication skills     Accuracy and keen eye for detail     Self-motivated, nimble and able to learn quickly.     Good organizational skills, able to prioritize and multi-task.     High level of professionalism and commitment     Proven ability to work independently and as a member of a wider Finance team     Energized by working in a fast-paced and dynamic team environment.     Not afraid to challenges and initiate process improvements.     Should be able to add value to the business and good team player.

column2: Skill required:Record To Report - Balance Sheet Account Reconciliations  Designation:Finance Transition Svcs Analyst  Qualifications:B.B.M/BBA/BCom/Master of Business Administration/MCom  Years of Experience:3 to 5 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions. The Record to Report team helps clients and organizations in their operational efficiency and balance sheet integrity, cuts time to close and safeguards compliance with regulatory requirements. The areas where this team's expertise lies is in posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations, preparing cash forecasting statement, supporting month end closing, preparing reports and supports in audits. The Balance Sheet Reconciliations team focuses on balance sheet analysis which involves evaluating all balance sheet accounts against sub-ledger or other non-general ledger-based source data. The role requires a good understanding of P&L accounts, general ledger, bookkeeping, journal entry, voucher entry, trial balance, and month-end reporting.  What are we looking for? Ability to establish strong client relationship  Ability to manage multiple stakeholders  Ability to meet deadlines  Ability to perform under pressure  Agility for quick learning Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems  Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors  In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management  You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments  The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column2: Experience Required:  5-12 years Location:  Greater Noida (1 position) and Chennai (1 position) Working Days:  Monday to Saturday (or Friday) Company Overview:  Global MNC in India. Job Summary:  We are seeking experienced Senior Financial Managers with a solid background in financial planning, statutory compliance, and financial accounting. The ideal candidates will have 5-12 years of experience managing financial operations, ensuring compliance with statutory requirements, and coordinating with various departments to support the company's financial health. Key Responsibilities: Financial Planning: Manage cash withdrawal processes including expenses and customer payments. Handle foreign currency remittance and the issuance of supporting documents. Oversee daily fund status management, including bank and cash balance. Prepare and revise daily payments received and payments made. Control loan accounts to optimize interest savings. Statutory Compliances: Prepare TDS calculations and ensure timely deposits. Prepare and file GST Returns (GSTR-1) on a monthly basis. Prepare and file GST Returns (GSTR-3B) and discharge GST liabilities monthly. Review salary sheets and ensure the payment of ESIC and PF. Compute corporate tax quarterly as per Income Tax Law. Review GST and Income Tax, as well as direct tax-related notifications. Manage corporate returns, transfer pricing audits, tax audits, financial statements, and annual GST returns (GST-9/9C). Ensure all tax returns are filed before due dates. Close monthly books of accounts, including direct and indirect expenses and cash flow, according to HQ requirements. Financial Accounting: Identify and evaluate the reality of tangible and intangible assets. Identify and evaluate the reality of other assets. Prepare and review financial statements and annexed statements for HQ. Handle tax accounting and settlement of accounts. Manage tax adjustments including gross income, deductible expenses, TDS on gross-up salary, deductions, reductions, exemptions, and reserve fund adjustments. Oversee accounting and tax-related slip (voucher) management. Issue tax invoices, credit notes, debit notes, Ewaybills, and IRNs. Manage tax accounting operations. Coordinate with the HQ team and monitor day-to-day financial operations. Prepare reconciliation statements for financial and calendar year accounting. Prepare financial vouchers and pass closing entries. Additional Responsibilities: Prepare provisions at year-end for doubtful debtors/security and non-moving/slow-moving inventory. Prepare additional reports and documents as required by HQ, the MD, and statutory auditors. Coordinate with other departments to make decisions in the company's interest. Prepare forecasting, budget, and cash flow projections. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field (CA preferred, but not limited). 5-12 years of relevant experience in financial management, planning, and statutory compliance. In-depth knowledge of TDS, GST, corporate tax, and other statutory regulations. Proficiency in financial software and MS Office Suite. Excellent analytical and decision-making skills. Strong communication and coordination abilities. Application Process:  Interested candidates are invited to submit their latest resume and cover letter to the email address below. Email: admin@buddtree.com Application Deadline:  June 30, 2024 (URGENT) Buddtree Management Group is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity and inclusion. We look forward to welcoming talented Senior Financial Managers to our team.
